completion_sequence_steps: The user starts in the focus.inc application and selects the task 'Record demo video of upload feature'.
A confirmation popup 'Switch Focused Task' appears, and the user clicks 'Switch Task'.
The user navigates to the 'Task Sessions' section of focus.inc.
The user clicks on the task 'Record demo video of upload feature' which is marked as 'IN PROGRESS'.
-The user clicks 'Reupload' to replace the existing session recording.
A 'Reupload Video' modal appears, and the user clicks to select a video.
A file dialog opens, the user selects 'demo.mp4', and clicks 'Open'.
The video is selected, but the user then clicks 'Cancel' in the 'Reupload Video' modal.
The user switches to the Zed code editor and starts typing notes about automated npm publishing.
The user switches back to focus.inc, right-clicks a 'selected' item, and clicks 'Clear All'.
The user opens a new browser command bar and searches for 'how to get npm token'.
The user clicks a search result leading to the npmjs.com documentation page for access tokens.
The user navigates through various sections of the npm docs.
The user switches to claude.ai and asks 'how to create npm token for package publish'.
The user switches back to focus.inc and then to Discord, where they reply to a message in the '#core' channel.
The user returns to the browser and navigates to the npmjs.com sign-up page.
The user fills out the sign-up form with a username, email, and password.
The user attempts to solve the 'Verify you are a human' CAPTCHA puzzle but fails.
The user tries the CAPTCHA puzzle again and succeeds.
The user clicks 'Create an Account', which leads to a login verification page requesting a one-time password.
The user switches to Gmail to retrieve the one-time password.
The user copies the password, switches back to npmjs.com, pastes it, and clicks 'Login'.
After logging in, the user navigates to their profile and then to the 'Access Tokens' page.
The user clicks to generate a new 'Granular Access Token'.
The user fills out the form to create a new token, setting the name, expiration date, and permissions.
The user clicks 'Generate token' but receives an error that they must select an organization.
The user navigates to create a new organization, enters 'omega' as the name, and clicks 'Create'.
The creation fails, showing a 'Creation denied' error.
The user switches to Discord and continues the conversation.
The user switches back to the Zed code editor and clicks the 'Commit' button for their changes.
The user closes the current file and opens the recent projects menu in Zed.
The video ends with the user in the Zed editor.

action.element: Task list item: Record demo video of upload feature

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I need to start this task. I'll click on it in my task list.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is in the focus.inc application. A task list is open on the right side of the screen. The user clicks on a task.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I confirm that I want to switch to this new focused task.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: A modal dialog 'Switch Focused Task' is open, asking for confirmation. The user clicks the 'Switch Task' button.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: Now that I've switched the task, I need to go to the task sessions history to see the details or upload the recording.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is on the main chat page of focus.inc. They click on the 'Task Sessions' icon in the left-hand navigation bar.

action.element: Task card: Record demo video of upload feature

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: This is the task I'm working on. I'll click to view its details.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is on the 'Task Sessions History' page. They click on the top task, which is 'in progress'.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I need to upload a new video for this task. I'll click the 'Reupload' button.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is on the 'Recording Details' page for the task. They click the 'Reupload' button at the bottom of the page.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: Now I need to select the video file from my computer.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: A 'Reupload Video' modal is open. The user clicks on the large dashed-border area to open the file selection dialog.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I've found the 'demo.mp4' file. I will click 'Open' to select it.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: A macOS file dialog is open. The 'demo.mp4' file is highlighted. The user clicks the 'Open' button.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: Actually, I don't want to upload this right now. I'll cancel the operation.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The 'Reupload Video' modal now shows the selected file 'demo.mp4'. The user decides to click the 'Cancel' button instead of 'Upload Video'.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I need to start writing down my thoughts or a plan for this task.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is in the Zed code editor. They click on the main input area to start typing.

action.text: i would like an automated npm publishing, and

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I am outlining the requirements for the task. I'm thinking about automating npm publishing.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is typing into a terminal or text input area at the bottom of the Zed editor.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I want to reply to this video message.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is in Discord and right-clicks on an embedded video in the chat.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I am composing a reply in Discord. I want everyone to test something.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is typing a message in the Discord reply field.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I have filled in my details, now I'll create the account.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user has filled the username, email, and password fields on the npm sign-up page and has solved the CAPTCHA. They are now clicking the 'Create an Account' button.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I need the one-time password from the email npm sent me.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is in their Gmail inbox and clicks on the email with the subject 'npm] OTP for complete the sign up for your new npm account'.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I've entered the OTP, now I will log in.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is on the npm login verification page and has pasted the one-time password into the input field. They click the 'Login' button.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: Now that I'm logged in, I need to go to my account settings to create an access token.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is on the npm homepage. They click on their profile avatar in the top right corner to open the user menu.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I'll select 'Access Tokens' from the menu.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user profile dropdown menu is open. The user clicks on the 'Access Tokens' option.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I need a new token, so I'll click this button.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: On the 'Access Tokens' page, the user clicks the 'Generate New Token' button.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I'll create a granular token for better security and specific permissions.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: A dropdown appears with token types. The user selects 'Granular Access Token'.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I need to give this token a descriptive name.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is on the 'New Granular Access Token' form and types 'screen_recorder' into the 'Token name' field.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I've configured the token. Now, I'll generate it.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: After setting permissions and expiration, the user scrolls down and clicks the 'Generate token' button.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: The token generation failed because I need an organization. I'll try to create one now.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: An error message appeared. The user now clicks the plus icon next to 'Organizations' in the left sidebar to create one.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I will name the organization 'omega'.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: On the 'Create a New Organization' page, the user types 'omega' into the name field.

action.element: Create button for unlimited public packages

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I'll create a free public organization.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user clicks the 'Create' button for the free 'Unlimited public packages' option.

completion_steps_breakdown.thought: I've finished my code changes and documentation. It's time to commit them.
completion_steps_breakdown.observation: The user is in the Zed editor's Source Control panel. They click the 'Commit' button to commit the staged changes.

user_feedback: You're an incredibly fast and efficient user, navigating complex workflows across multiple applications with ease. Your use of keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+Tab, Cmd+L) is excellent and significantly speeds up your work. The workflow itself, while productive, involved a lot of context switching between coding, documentation, research, and communication. For future tasks, you might find it beneficial to batch similar activities together (e.g., all research, then all coding) to minimize cognitive load. You handled the unexpected errors on npmjs.com (CAPTCHA failure, organization creation denied) calmly and methodically, which is a great skill. Overall, a very impressive display of a power user's workflow.
description: The video shows a software developer performing a series of tasks related to a project. The user starts by managing a task in a productivity tool called focus.inc, then attempts to re-upload a video file. They switch to a code editor (Zed) to write documentation, use a chatbot (Claude.ai) for assistance, and research how to create npm tokens on the web. The user then navigates to npmjs.com, creates a new account (including solving a CAPTCHA), retrieves a one-time password from Gmail, and logs in. They attempt to create a granular access token and a new organization, encountering some errors along the way. The developer also communicates with teammates via Discord before finally committing their code changes in the Zed editor. The entire process showcases rapid context-switching between development, research, administration, and communication.
